isis.stitle: TSI 00-08-05 - Medium Duty Instrument Cluster Diagnostics

geninfo.para: This letter provides information for the medium duty instrument cluster operation and diagnostics for 2000, 3000, 4000 and 8000 Models built from January 1, 1994 to the present time.

There are two types of medium duty instrument clusters in use: Early Design Medium Duty (MD)-This design has two sets of 8 dip switches on the rear of the cluster, a mechanical oil pressure gauge, requires programming for proper function and can be used with mechanical or electronic engines. Medium Duty Data Link (MDDL)-This design uses two jumpers on the rear of the cluster, does not require programming and can only be used with electronic engines.
The information contained in this letter will supplement and clarify the information available in Service Sections CTS-5257 and CTS-5228 found in Group 08 of the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

geninfo.title: DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS
geninfo.para: The following is a description of the tools available for troubleshooting and diagnosing the medium duty instrument cluster.

Pro-Link with IPC Cartridge- This tool can be used to set the internal program and exercise the data link driven gauges in the MDDL cluster. Note that this tool will exercise some of the gauges in the MD cluster only if they are programmed to read from the data link.

note.para: The IPC cartridge will not work with a vehicle equipped with an International NGD 3-Box engine controller.

geninfo.para: Pro-Link with General Purpose Heavy Duty Cartridge- This tool can be used to read and display the information on the data link and verify that the cluster is displaying the data it is receiving.

EZ-Tech with IPC Software (New)-This software may be used to either exercise the data link driven gauges or program the instrument cluster. It is more user friendly than the Pro-Link tool. A training program will be provided for this tool in the near future.
EZ-Tech with 32-bit Master Diagnostics (New)-This may be used to monitor the data link. For cluster specific data link monitoring go to Sessions>>Open>>double click on Instrumentpanelcluster.ssn.

Diagnostic Flow Diagram (New)- The diagram (attached) will guide the troubleshooting effort and indicate when a diagnostic tool should be used and what test to perform. The flow diagram includes pin-outs, gauge pins, voltage levels and circuit numbers (Figure 1 and Figure 2).

geninfo.title: Diagnostics for Frequently Asked Questions/Issues About Instrument Clusters
geninfo.para: Issue: The cluster appears to have locked up.

Diagnosis: Use one of the diagnostic tools listed in this letter to check the data link to insure that data is available. A data driven gauge will lock-up (cease to function) if the data is not available.
Issue: The cluster appears to go through diagnostic sweeps.
Diagnosis: Check for poor or intermittent power and ground feeds within the vehicle. The cluster will reset even if power or ground is removed for only a fraction of a second.
Issue: Mechanical odometer is not changing or incrementing.
Diagnosis 1: If the odometer is clicking but not incrementing, either the odometer is defective or the odometer is binding in the holding bracket.
Diagnosis 2: If the odometer is not clicking, the circuit board may be defective or the cluster is not receiving vehicle speed data on the data link.
Issue: The new service cluster installed doesn't work properly.
Diagnosis1:If an MDDL cluster is installed in a vehicle that is not equipped with an electronic engine it will not function. An MD cluster must be installed.
Diagnosis 2:If an MD cluster was installed, it must be programmed to function. Use the EZ-Tech tool with IPC software to facilitate programming.

note.para: All cluster DIP switches must be set to "0" for the EZ-Tech program to be active.

geninfo.para: Issue: What program should be used for the cluster?
Diagnosis: The vehicle line set ticket will indicate the required program.
Issue:What program should be used to program a vehicle with an International NGD 3-Box electronic engine controller?

Diagnosis:The speedometer program must be set to 0101111100. The tachometer set to 011. If the vehicle is equipped with a 2-speed axle,with an axle ratio of 1.39, set the axle ratio switch to the 1position. If the odometer is to increment in kilometers, place the kilometer/miles switch to the 1position.

geninfo.title: Intermittent Problems
geninfo.para: Intermittent problems are the most difficult to diagnose but are usually caused by one of the following:

item.para: Loose connections caused by corroded, spread or improperly seated terminals.
An electrically noisy alternator causing communication problems on the data link.
